stats.desc: Custom attribute that will display as numbers.

levels.desc: Numerical attribute that will display as progress bar.

properties.desc: Custom attribute that will display as text and rectangles on NFT market places.

advanced.desc: All properties are used to modify what is displayed on the NFT viewer on OpenSea and other marketplaces.

bgColor.desc: The color will be rendered as background color of the item on OpenSea.
bgColor.title: Background Color

youtube.desc: A URL to a YouTube video.

animation.desc: A URL to a multi-media attachment for the item. Also supports HTML pages, allowing you to build rich experiences and interactive NFTs using JavaScript canvas, WebGL, and more.

description.1: You are editing the default properties for all the tokens from the contract

2.1: You are editing the specific properties for the token

description.3: Select the Lock or Key you want to edit properties for. If you save metadata for lock only, it will be used for all keys which do not have any metadata set.

baseUriError.desc: You need to change your base token URI to be editable by the Dashboard.
baseUriError.title: Unexpected Base Token URI

roles.desc: Your Event includes multiple roles, such as "Event Manager", or "Verifiers". Here you can configure which addresses are assigned which roles.
roles.title: Roles

emails.desc: Customize the emails sent to users when they purchase your lock's membership NFTs.

baseUri.desc: Update the base token URI of the lock that is used to create the individual token's URIs.

form.error1: Failed to update base token URI.
form.error2: The base token URI must be a valid URL that ends with a final /

baseUri.title: Base token URI

contractName.desc: Customize the contract name on chain.

form.desc1: This value will be set on the contract but the NFT metadata will remain unchanged if you have set a value there.
form.error1: There is an issue updating the event name.
form.error3: Event name should have at least 3 characters.

contractName.title: Contract name

advanced.desc: This section lets you configure referral fees, hooks and upgrade your lock to the latest version of the protocol.
advanced.title: Advanced

no.desc: The maximum number of keys a specific address can own. By default, a given address can only own a single key.

form.success: Maximum number of keys per address successfully updated

memTerms.desc: Membership Terms include the price, currency, duration, payment mechanisms... as well as cancellation terms and transfer fees.
memTerms.title: Membership Terms

duration.desc: Set up how long each membership lasts.

form.title: Membership duration (in days):
form.error1: We could not update the duration for this event.

duration.title: Duration

quantity.desc: The maximum number of memberships that can be sold from your contract. Note: there is no limit to the number of memberships that can be airdropped by an event manager or key granter.

form.title: Enter quantity
form.error1: We could not update the amount of memberships for sale for this event.
form.error2: Please choose a number of memberships for sale for your event.

quantity.title: Quantity

transfers.desc: Make tokens non-transferable (soulbound) or apply fees on transfers.

form.desc: You can set up a fee when member transfer their key to another account or wallet. The fee is taken in time.
form.error: Failed to update the values, please try again.
form.title: Transfer fee (%)

transfers.title: Transfers

toggle.desc1: Members can transfer their valid key(s) to any other wallet.
toggle.desc2: Transfers are disabled and tokens are soul-bound.
toggle.title: Transfer authorized

cancellation.desc: Select how your contract should handle cancellations and optionally issue refunds.

form.error1: There was an issue updating the refund policy. Please try again.

allow.desc: If you enable a free trial period, users will be able to get a full refund when they cancel their memberships. It is strongly advised to add transfer penalties when enabling free trials to avoid risks of people stealing funds from your contract.
allow.title: Allow Trial

cancellation.title: Cancellation

cancel.desc: Enable this feature if you wish to apply a cancellation penalty. The penalty is a percentage of the membership cost. The refund amount is pro-rated after the penalty has been applied. If you select 100%, the users will not receive any refund.
cancel.error: This field accept percentage value between 0 and 100.
cancel.title: Cancel Penalty

payments.desc: Payments settings lets you change the price and currency of your memberships, as well as enable credit cards and recurring payments.
payments.title: Payments

notManager.2: and this address is not a manager for this event. If you want to update details, please connect as event manager.
notManager.3: and this address is not a manager or payer for this receipt. If you want to update details, please connect as event manager or payer of the transaction.

events.description: An Event is a membership smart contract you create, deploy, and own on Unlock Protocol
events.noContractCreated: You have not created any membership contract yet.

footer.description: Receive fresh news about beyondClub, including new features and opportunities to contribute

wallet.goBack: Back to using your crypto wallet

desc.1: Once you upload the csv, you can see all the list of memberships to be granted.

2.1: Due to block size limit, you can only airdrop at most
2.2: NFT at once, but you can re-upload the same file multiple times and the duplicates will automatically discarded.

desc.3: If you don't have wallet address of the user, leave the field blank and fill out their email. We will airdrop the NFT to their email.
desc.5: Download the template file and fill out the values in the format.

desc.1: Enter the email address that will receive the membership NFT
desc.2: A confirmation email will be sent to your recipient with the QR code and link for NFT.

address.desc: Enter the wallet address or an ENS that will receive the membership NFT
address.error: Address already holds the maximum number of memberships.
address.title: Wallet address

manager.desc: Key manager will be granted the permission to transfer or to cancel the membership. By default, your address is set as manager.
manager.title: Key Manager

title.1: Organize an event and sell tickets

default.2: let me create my own membership contract

checkout.desc: Customize your membership checkout experience. The preview on the left is updated in realtime.
checkout.title: Checkout Builder

link.desc: Copy the checkout URL to share, or download a JSON file for your implementation
link.title: Share the checkout link or download the configuration

basic.desc: Customize the checkout modal interaction & additional behavior

hide.desc: When enabled, sold out locks are not shown to users when they load the checkout modal.
hide.title: Hide Sold Out Locks

title.desc: Title for your checkout. This will show up on the head.
title.title: Title

refAddr.desc: (Recommended) The address of the purchase referrer. This address may receive a referrer fee if the event was configured for this, and will receive Unlock Governance tokens if applicable. Put your address if unsure.
refAddr.title: Referrer Address

skipRecp.desc: When set to true, the checkout flow will not let the user customize the recipient of the NFT membership.
skipRecp.title: Skip Recipient

msgToSign.desc: (Optional) If supplied, the user is prompted to sign this message using their wallet. Your application needs to handle the signature to identify the user.
msgToSign.error: Message to Sign can't be empty
msgToSign.title: Message to Sign

skipSelect.desc: When set to true and there is only one lock, the checkout flow will skip the lock selection step.
skipSelect.title: Skip Select

pessimistic.desc: By default, to reduce friction, we do not require users to wait for the transaction to be mined before offering them to be redirected. If you check this, users will need to wait for the transaction to have been mined in order to proceed to the next step.
pessimistic.title: Pessimistic

redirectBtn.desc: Show a custom text on the final button that triggers a redirect
redirectBtn.error: Redirect Button Text can't be empty
redirectBtn.title: Redirect Button Text

redirectUrl.desc: The address of a webpage where the user will be redirected when they complete the checkout flow.
redirectUrl.title: Redirect URL

persCheckout.desc: If checked, the checkout modal cannot be closed. This is especially useful when the checkout UI is embedded directly. Leave unchecked if unsure.
persCheckout.title: Persistent Checkout

basic.title: Configure the basics
basic.changeIconDesc: Upload an image to use as the icon for your checkout

config.error: Please select a configuration or create a new one.

choose.desc: Create a new configuration or continue enhance the existing one for your checkout modal
choose.title: Choose a configuration

config.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this checkout configuration? This will break any links that use this configuration and cannot be undone.

events.desc: Select the events that you would like to featured in this configured checkout modal
events.title: Configured events
events.featuredDesc: Adjust each lock & behavior by click on the gear icon

preview.readyForUse: This checkout modal is ready for you to use.
preview.eventRequired: An event is required in order to see the full preview.

description.main_ethereum_test_network__do_not_use_f: Main Ethereum test network. Do not use for production.
description.the_original_and_most_secure_evm_network: The original and most secure EVM network. Gas fees are expensive on this network.
description.gnosis_chain_is_one_of_the_first_ethereu: Gnosis Chain is one of the first Ethereum sidechains and has stayed true to its values.
description.sepolia_is_the_primary_testnet_recommend: Sepolia is the primary testnet recommended by the Ethereum community for dapp development.
description.base_is_a_secure,_low-cost,_builder-frie: Base is a secure, low-cost, builder-friendly Ethereum L2 built to bring the next billion users onchain.
description.polygon_is_a_side-chain_to_build_and_sca: Polygon is a side-chain to build and scale your projects on Ethereum, the world's largest blockchain ecosystem.
description.arbitrum_one_is_a_layer_2_(l2)_chain_run: Arbitrum One is a Layer 2 (L2) chain running on top of Ethereum Mainnet that enables high-throughput, low cost smart contracts operations.
description.optimism_is_a_layer_2_optimistic_rollup_: Optimism is a Layer 2 Optimistic Rollup network designed to utilize the strong security guarantees of Ethereum while reducing its cost and latency.
